question: A certain sum of money yields 1261 Rs. as compound interest for 3 years at 5% per annum. The sum is :
explanation:
Let the principal be x Rs. Now, 
$latex C.I. = P\\left [ \\left ( 1+\\frac{R}{100} \\right )^{T} - 1 \\right ]&s=1$
$latex => 1261 = x\\left [ \\left ( 1+\\frac{5}{100} \\right )^{3} - 1 \\right ]&s=1$
$latex => 1261 = x\\left ( \\frac{9261}{8000} - 1 \\right )&s=1$
$latex => 1261 = x\\left ( \\frac{9261-8000}{8000} \\right ) = \\frac{1261x}{8000}&s=1$
$latex => x = \\frac{1261\\times 8000}{1261} = 8000 Rs.&s=1$
Hence option [C] is correct answer.
